form.name: form1

div.span: NPCSD Is CLOSED to Students Until Further Notice

span.p:
The New Philadelphia City School District will be closed to students until further notice.
During this time, there will be no school or school-sponsored athletics, activities, or meetings.
Student instruction will continue and food will be available to all children 18 years of age or younger.
Need Technology Support? Call our Technology Help Desk at (866) 779-7748

¿Como puedo contactar con alguien que hable en espanol?
Para hacer cualquier consulta en espanol, rogamos llame al teléfono 330.866.0623
Si no podemos contestar en ese momento, deje su nombre y número de teléfono y le devolveremos la llamada.
IMPORTANT LINK
NPCSD Alternative Learning Plan During Extended School Closure and other COVID-19 Information

div.span: Our School Nurses Are Here For You

source.p: To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: New Philadelphia City Schools are still accepting registration for 2020-2021 Kindergarten students. Students must be 5 by August 1st, 2020. Please follow the normal online registration process through the Parent Portal. All required documents will need to be either scanned and uploaded to Parent Portal or emailed to Mary Knepper in registration [email protected] If parents do not have access to scan documents, photos can be taken and emailed to Mary or they may be dropped off at the Administration offices. Screening will take place in the Fall at the beginning of the school year, parents will be contacted via email/mail to schedule appointments.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: After completing the online Registration, please submit the following required documents to complete the registration process.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Any registration forms that were not submitted electronically on-line

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Birth Certificate, with seal

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Proof of Residence, such as utility bill for gas, electric or water

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Legal Documents (if applicable, pertaining to custody)

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Immunization Records

span.p: Building Transfer and Open Enrollment requests can be made by the following links * Please note that these requests are for Kindergarten students ONLY

img.title: Best in music
img.span: The New Philadelphia City School District Receives National Recognition For The Fifth Consecutive Year!

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The New Philadelphia City School District

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education for the fifth consecutive year! New Philadelphia City School District is one of less than 5% of districts across the nation, and the only in Tuscarawas County, receiving this prestigious award in 2020.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The Best Communities for Music Education designation is awarded to districts that demonstrate outstanding achievement in efforts to provide music access and education to all students. To qualify for the Best Communities designation, NAMM & the University of Kansas reviews the school’s music education funding, graduation requirements, music class participation, instruction time, facilities, support for the music program, and community music-making programs.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.div: Check out our talented Central Elementary students in their annual musical!

span.span: Scholarships totaling $201,000 will still be awarded to 104 members of the NPHS Class of 2020. Scholarship recipients will receive information in the mail on how to obtain the monetary awards they have been granted.

img.title: we need you
img.span: Welty Middle School Primary Source History Project- The History of the COVID-19 Virus

span.div: We need you to help us remember the effects of this Pandemic.
Together, we can create history so that future generations can know how COVID-19 affected our community and how our community responded.

br.span: Please see the attached fact sheet from the Tuscarawas County Health Department in regards to testing in our county.

img.title: lunch
img.span: Comida gratis a todos los niños/as de New Philadelphia.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Estamos ya listos para empezar a dar comidas gratis a los niños/as mientras las escuelas están cerradas por el brote de Coronavirus. Los paquetes de comidas se distribuirán a los niños/as una vez por semana. Estos paquetes consistirán de cinco desayunos completos y cinco almuerzos completos. Las comidas se distribuirán a través de un sistema drive-thru en todas las escuelas primarias y en la MS/HS. Los estudiantes deberán ir acompañados por uno de sus padres o tutores para recibir las comidas. El dia y horario para la recogida de comida es el siguiente:

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: SOLO esta semana, la recogida será el jueves 19 de Marzo entre las 12:00 y la 1:00 de la tarde, o entre las 5:00 y las 6:00 de la tarde.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: A partir del próximo martes 24 de Marzo y durante las semanas siguientes, los paquetes de comida se distribuirán todos los martes entre las 12:00 y la 1:00 de la tarde, o entre las 5:00 y las 6:00 de la tarde, hasta nuevo aviso.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Rogamos llame a la escuela donde recogerá los paquetes de comida antes de las 9 de la mañana, con el número total de niños/as en sus familia, para que así podamos prepararlos adecuadamente.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Puede recoger las comidas en cualquiera de las escuelas, no tiene que ser la escuela en la que asiste su estudiante.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

img.title: lunch
img.span: Free Food to All New Philadelphia Children

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Free Food to All New Philadelphia Children.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We are now ready to begin providing free meals to children while the school buildings are closed during the coronavirus outbreak. Meal bundles will be distributed to children once a week. The meal bundles will consist of five breakfast complete meals and five lunch complete meals. Meals will be distributed through a drive-thru system at all elementary schools and at the MS/HS locations. Children must be with a parent or guardian in order to receive the meal bundle. The schedule is as follows for meal pick up day and times:

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This week ONLY pick up will be Thursday, March 19th between Noon-1:00 p.m. or between 5:00-6:00 p.m.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Beginning next Tuesday, March 24th and the weeks to follow meal bundles will be distributed every Tuesday between Noon-1:00 p.m. or between 5:00-6:00 p.m. until further notice.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please call the building you are picking up the food bundles by 9am with the total number of children in your family so we can properly prepare.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: You can pick up the meals at any of our locations, not just the school your child(ren) attends

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: New Philadelphia City Schools will provide all students the opportunity to achieve their highest potential to become educated, self-sufficient, and responsible citizens. We are committed to providing every student a diverse, quality education within a safe and secure environment through a dedicated, innovative and highly qualified staff in partnership with parents and the community-at-large.
